sentences.sContent: In life, everybody has their moments of glory although they may go unnoticed like the accompanist. This does not mean, however, that they are any less important than anyone else.
sentences.sContent_eng: In life, everybody has their moments of glory although they may go unnoticed like the accompanist. This does not mean, however, that they are any less important than anyone else.
sentences.sCn: 在生活中，每个人都有着自己光辉的瞬间，虽然他们可能会与伴奏者一样不被人注目，但是，这并不意味着他们的重要程度会比其他人低。

words.tran: 陪伴，伴随；伴奏（accompany的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: someone who plays a musical instrument while another person sings or plays the main tune
